column4: can someone help me fix this message that shows up when obconf (openbox) is running - http://pastebin.ca/946483
can someone help me fix this message that shows up when obconf (openbox) is running - http://pastebin.ca/946486 ?
did you set those colors?
because those aren't proper color codes. they have too many digits/etters
im just getting used to using it, what do you mean by setting the colours?
change your theme to something else
how do i set the colours at the moment my desktop has my own theme which is outside openbox
wherever those colors, i.e. #7eee8cf, are indicated. I don't use openbox but I assume it's in the theme file mentioned at the bottom.
ok so i should remove it before running openbox is that what your saying

not really, but you could try that. the problem is that whatever is calling for those colors is written wrong. those aren't color codes. look up html color codes and you can see how they're supposed to work.
they're six digits, not seven
yeah i noticed that now since you mentioned it, the problem is how do i locate what is calling those colours
I'm thinking it's probaby that macos theme
it shows you the location of that
probably is going to try changing it and see what happens or better dwnlaod an openbox theme
it looks like a bad theme in general, but you could probably fix it
doubt that unless i get help, wouldnt know where to start
http://blog.myspace.com/blog/rss.cfm?friendID=179436880
ack wrong...
http://icculus.org/openbox/index.php/Help:Themes
that one
will read that thanx
i took out the macosx theme but i dont think that is the problem im now using an open box default theme and it gives me this when i run obconf http://pastebin.ca/946509 what can you suggest?
